StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateMapsAddress]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@AddressId uniqueidentifier, @StreetAddress1 varchar(75), @StreetAddress2 varchar(75)=null, @City varchar(30)=null, @State varchar(30)=null, @ZipCode varchar(9), @La.tude int = null, @Longitude int = null, @GeoLoca.onId uniqueidentifier=null, @GeoCodeDate date.me = null, --@LastUpdateDate date.me, @LastUpdateUserId uniqueidentifier
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT AddressId FROM MapsAddress WHERE AddressId = @AddressId) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Employee already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE MapsAddress SET Street1=@StreetAddress1, Street2=@StreetAddress2, City=@City, State=@State, ZipCode=@ZipCode, La.tude=@La.tude, Longitude=@Longitude, GeoLoca.onId=@GeoLoca.onId, GeoCodeDate=@GeoCodeDate, LastUpdateDate=GETDATE(), LastUpdateUserId=@LastUpdateUserId WHERE AddressId = @AddressId END ELSE BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Employee does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO MapsAddress (AddressId, Street1, Street2, City, State, ZipCode, La.tude, Longitude, GeoLoca.onId, GeoCodeDate, LastUpdateDate, LastUpdateUserId) VALUES (@AddressId, @StreetAddress1, @StreetAddress2, @City, @State, @ZipCode, @La.tude, @Longitude, @GeoLoca.onId, @GeoCodeDate, GETDATE(), @LastUpdateUserId) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
